profileText: a Representative from Missouri; born in St. Louis, Mo., July 21, 1976; graduated from Cardinal Ritter College Prep High School, St. Louis, Mo., 1994; attended Harris-Stowe State University, St. Louis, Mo., 1995–1996; RN Diploma, Lutheran School of Nursing, St. Louis, Mo., 2008; teacher; nurse; pastor; community organizer; unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United States Senate in 2016; unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Sixteenth Congress in 2018; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Seventeenth and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 2021-present).
